page.title: 03ONE MAN'S INFLUENCE,DRAYTON
page.content: Born in the late 19th century, {R.G.Carter}was the main influence in changing{Drayton}from a small rural community into the flourishing residential area that it is now.The firm of{builders}that he set up is famous throughout East Anglia.He was a true Drayton man,having been born and brought up in the village.Among other things,he rebuilt the{Cock Inn} where his grandfather was landlord and the lych gate of the church was erected in his memory.Other memorials given to the village by the Carter family are the{Florence Carter {Recreation Ground,}in the centre of the village,given in memory of R.G. Carter's first wife and the{Bob Carter {Leisure Centre,}built in{1979,}in memory of his son,{R.E.Carter.
